My first project: Ice Breaker    Name: David Liang

Title: My Cultural Marathon

time: 6:30 minutes

1 year ago God started talking to me that I should build a new tunnel to connect the East and the West. I founded the student organization Belhaven University Far East movement and I am currently the president. We have been conducting cultural events on campus and we have been building relationships with local charity organizations and worldwide Christian ministries in order to serve our communities as well as collaborate to develop art and cultural projects that could help foster cultural understanding between the American and Chinese peoples. However ambitious this vision may sound, it started in China 13 years ago on one afternoon when I decided that I wanted to become a good English speaker and travel around the world. 

I shared my idea with my friends and they all laughed at me, even my parents. In reality, there was no way I could make it. I came from the typical lower class Chinese family and my parents obeyed the single child policy so well that I never got to learn what sibling competition is. My parents did not have much education and they spent their entire lives working at local factories. We lived in a slum area and I grew up without fancy clothes, no pets and all my toys were self-invented. I borrowed textbooks from my cousins when I attended elementary school and my parents’ savings never went beyond the 4th digit. 

So, to speak good English and travel around the world, people would say “no way.” 
But I looked at myself into the mirror and I thought that even though I had nothing, I at least had faith. So, I started my ambitious language Marathon and began to practice my English every day.

I purchased a book from LiYang Crazy English,  one of the biggest English education services in China, and practiced pronunciation day and night.
I memorized Disney movies and tried to act out the stories. During the week days, I shouted English in the public, such as in buses crowded with people, at restaurants, and shopping malls. Occasionally, I also dreamed in English and I would practice singing nursery songs. Such as “If you are happy and you know it clap your hands”

In 2004, I became a Christian and I met an old American missionary at my church. He literally changed my life. His name is Jim Marshall but I call him my daddy in faith now. He baptized me in a public swimming pool and spiritually adopted me as his son in faith. In 2005, with Jim’s help, I developed my ambition further. I wanted to rebuild my childhood in English. By doing that with me, Jim has been reliving his own in me.  It was a moment like when Paul found his Timothy. He began to home school me over the Internet and he spent every possible minute to teach me and read with me.

During the entire 5 years after Jim left China and before I came to America, our being together over the internet could be imagined as if we were shopping in an American cultural mall. You could imagine that we would visit the Literary Bar at night, where we would open a bottle of “Mark Twin’s Classics” and devour the “Huckle Berry Finn Cake”, then we explored how “Do little” became “Do Nobel” and then we would enter into the “CS Lewis’ Wardrobe” and found our way into “Alex’s wonderland.” 

Not surprisingly, in the “Philosophy Kitchen”, we would grind through Leo Tolstoy, Emanuel Kant, Nietzsche, etc. in our intellectual food processor and seasoned the puree with the Biblical pepper. 

In the “Science Fair”, we would ride our bikes along the winding digestive tract; then we would get lost in the ear Labyrinth and end up playing the ear drums. We would swim inside the eyeballs to look for the blind spot, where we could get showered and changed.

In the “Cultural Zone”, we would bake our “America Pies” and enjoy suffering the “Growing pains”, we danced through the “High School Musicals” and explored the secret of dating. 

In 2006, I began teaching English in several institutions, including Crazy English and English First International. In 2008, with Jim’s help, I signed up for the Belhaven Virtual Campus and began my online Christian education.

In 2009, I was awarded an art scholarship by Belhaven University and I came to the USA in the summer of that year. Since then, I have upgraded my Childhood project into an “Adulthood Project” and Jim and I are still working on it. 

Today I have become a better man and blessedly upgraded in every area of my life, it seems I am every second getting closer to the finishing line of my 13 year marathon.
 But God has told me He has a second marathon for me and this time is in the Pacific Ocean. I pray that He will give me the strength to pull through and wisdom to navigate. I pray that  He will provide me a vessel big enough to contain many young people, American and Chinese alike, to work together and build more tunnels between the 2 major cultures connected by that great ocean. 
I pray that this divine voyage will allow me to discover a new continent where people of all cultures can live in peace and harmony. 


Amen.

Please check out my club 

BU Far East Movement

We conduct cultural event to promote understanding between people and serve our local communities through cultures. My 13 year cultural Marathon.

ACCREDITED SPEAKER #67 to be awarded today!

Ellie is the first FEMALE in her District to earn the designation... joining 7 men... including Wayne Choate, Don Ensch, George Gilbert, John Kinde and Dana LaMon.

Sheryl enlightens us as to what it's all about, why you would want to become an Accredited Speaker & how to go about doing it. She a...

Congratulations Cathey Armillas, Ellie Kay and Freddi Dogterom! 

They will continue on to Level II of the Accredited Speaker Program!

Congratulations to the three Applicants for the Toastmasters Accredited Speakers Program that passed Level 1 judging -- and will present Level 2 at the Toastmasters International Convention in Las Vegas!

For the dozen who applied and did not pass - get mentoring from ANY of the 66 who have earned it since 1981. We are here to support you in achieving your dreams!

Curious about the program - or how to earn this designation for professional speaking? Attend the full-day conference on Tuesday, August 11 at Caesar's Palace - the day before the Convention opens. Learn tips on the business and the award, from 12-15 Accredited Speakers that day!

. Las Vegas Seminar. Plan your travel to the 2015 TI Convention accordingly - arrive a DAY early!Tuesday, August 11, 2015 - Las Vegas, Nevada, USA - 8:30am - 5:00pm.

We are pleased to announce Barbara Khozam and Nicholas French will continue on to Level II of the Accredited Speaker Program – Congratulations!

David Marks, president of the Russian English Speakers Toastmasters club in London, flanks the Olympic BMW 3 Series sports car in front of the 2012 Olympic Stadium.
